question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable for display. Please help me implement this SVG image using code: a pair of earphones with a cord attached to them.

checklist.title: Is the basic structure of the earphones with cord accurately depicted?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code correctly represents the essential components of earphones: two earbuds, a connecting band or wire between them, and a cord extending from them. Score 0 if any of these components are missing, 5 if they're present but proportions are off, and 10 if the entire structure accurately resembles standard earphones.

checklist.title: Is the implementation of the earbuds detailed and realistic?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG code includes proper detailing of the earbuds (outer casing, cushions if applicable, speaker mesh indication). Deduct 3 points if the earbuds lack dimension (appear completely flat), 4 points if essential details are missing, and 5 points if they don't resemble real earbuds. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the earphone cord have natural curves and tension?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the cord is implemented with natural-looking curves using Bezier paths or similar techniques rather than straight lines. The cord should appear to have realistic tension and gravity effects. Score 0 for straight lines, 5 for basic curves, and 10 for realistic curves with proper tension visualization.

checklist.title: Are the SVG path commands used efficiently and appropriately?
checklist.description: Analyze whether the SVG implementation uses the most appropriate path commands (M, L, C, Q, A) for different parts of the earphones. Deduct 3 points for unnecessarily complex paths, 3 points for inefficient use of commands (e.g., using multiple line segments where curves would be better), and 4 points for not utilizing appropriate SVG elements for different components.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the SVG code is well-structured, uses appropriate viewBox dimensions, includes proper namespace declarations, and avoids hardcoded absolute positions where relative positioning would be better. Code with strong robustness should handle different display sizes properly, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if the SVG breaks on different screen sizes, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the SVG includes surprise features that enhance the visualization (e.g., 1. Animation of the cord swinging 2. Interactive elements like volume control or button clicks 3. Gradient or texture effects for realism). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant path segments that could be simplified 2. Unnecessary graphical elements unrelated to earphones 3. Overly complex effects that add little visual value but increase code complexity. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the redundant code significantly increases file size or performance issues.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review the code structure (clear grouping of elements using <g> tags, meaningful IDs/classes), use of reusable components, and optimization techniques (avoiding unnecessarily precise decimal values). Deduct 5 points if there's no logical grouping of elements; deduct 5 points if identical elements are duplicated instead of being reused; deduct 5 points if the file size is unnecessarily large due to poor optimization. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual representation meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Appropriate level of detail for the medium 2) Balanced proportions between earbuds and cord 3) Professional use of colors, shadows, or highlights to convey depth. Deduct 3 points for anatomically incorrect proportions, 5 points for unrealistic or jarring color choices, and 5 points for overly simplistic rendering that lacks visual interest. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is there any dynamic interaction or animation that enhances the visual?
checklist.description: Judge whether any animations or interactions (if included) enhance the visual representation: 1) Smooth animation timing functions for natural movement 2) Appropriate trigger events for interactions 3) Subtle effects that don't dominate the core visual. Deduct 5 points for jarring or unrealistic animations, 3 points for animations that run too quickly/slowly, and 5 points for interactive elements without proper visual feedback. The full score is 10 points.
